sense.name: the power to use something or someone; a resource available.
sense.examples: he used all the resources at his disposal. at his disposal, he found that he had art supplies and a deep desire to create.

sense.name: a method of tending to or managing the affairs of a some group of people (especially the group's business affairs).
sense.examples: A number of European leaders thought the administration's disposal of the treaty was worrisome.

sense.name: the act or means of getting rid of something.
sense.examples: The body's disposal was so expertly carried out that it was hard to find. A disposal of garbage in this receptacle will be seen as dumping. A disposal of my pride was in order.

sense.name: electric pig, garbage disposal; a kitchen appliance for disposing of garbage.
sense.examples: The disposal is clogged. A garbage disposal can be installed in the sink at the discretion of the owner. An apartment without a disposal is a deal-killer for most people.
